common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Connection and Processing Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot experiencing connection issues, failure to download LLMs, and processing errors resulting in non-responsiveness or error messages.  Suggested solutions include checking for PiecesOS updates, ensuring stable internet connection, removing OpenAI API keys, and verifying Pieces is allowed by firewall/antivirus.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* AmanSingh766 is experiencing an exception when trying to download local LLMs.
* The error message is "Connection closed before full header was received".

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue seems to be related to downloading local LLMs.
* The specific cause of the error is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mark-at-pieces requested the support logs for Pieces OS and asked if the issue occurs every time a local LLM is downloaded.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* AmanSingh766 has not yet responded to mark-at-pieces' request for information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is ongoing and further information may be available.
* The provided resources might be helpful for troubleshooting the issue.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue: Copilot Sonnet error response

**Key points raised:**

* User @gittydia reported an error message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong..." when using Pieces Copilot.
* @luigigalli confirmed the issue in macOS with PiecesOS version 11.0.19-staging.

**Problems identified:**

* The error message suggests an issue with processing Copilot requests.
* It's unclear if the problem is specific to the staging build or affects all users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggested waiting for the PiecesOS 11.0.4 release, which was supposed to include a fix.
* He also recommended @luigigalli to switch from the staging build to the production version 11.0.4.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It's unclear if the issue is resolved in PiecesOS 11.0.4.
* Further confirmation from @gittydia and @luigigalli is needed.

**Additional observations:**

* The issue might be related to other reported Copilot problems (linked in the initial comment).
* There are resources available for troubleshooting Pieces issues: existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users experiencing processing errors with Claude and Gemini models.
* Removing the OpenAI API key resolved the issue for some users.
* Updating to the latest version (11.0.3) and signing in to Pieces are recommended.

**Problems Identified:**

* Claude and Gemini models were experiencing issues.
* OpenAI API key might be causing failures.
* Local SSL certificate might be causing issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Switch to GPT4o model instead of Claude and Gemini.
* Remove the OpenAI API key.
* Update to the latest version (11.0.3) and sign in to Pieces.
* Uninstall & reinstall Pieces for Developers and PiecesOS.
* Confirm Windows Defender is not blocking Pieces requests.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The exact cause of the processing errors is still being investigated.
* The proposed solutions have reportedly resolved the issue for some users.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces is available for real-time debugging assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces Suite Installer and Application Errors
common_issues.description: Users reported various errors with the Pieces Suite installer and application on Windows, including installer failures, non-dismissable overlay messages, and Copilot processing errors. Suggested solutions include checking Windows Defender settings, updating the application, and removing the OpenAI API key. Some issues are still under investigation.

related_issues.title: suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)
related_issues.text:
suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

n/a

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)

```
  shane @ moa ❯ ~ cd .\Downloads\
  shane @ moa ❯ Downloads ./Pieces_Suite.appinstaller
ResourceUnavailable: Program 'Pieces_Suite.appinstaller' failed to run: An error occurred trying to start process 'C:\Users\shane\Downloads\Pieces_Suite.appinstaller' with working directory 'C:\Users\shane\Downloads'. The app didn't start.At line:1 char:1
+ ./Pieces_Suite.appinstaller
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~.
  shane @ moa ❯ Downloads
```


also tried double clicking in gui. same issue>

I also tried as user and admin

all failed
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key points raised:**

* The EXE installer for Windows was not working for some users.
* Users were experiencing issues with the app not starting after installation.
* Windows Defender was blocking the application.

**Problems identified:**

* The App Installer method for Windows may not be reliable.
* The cause of Windows Defender blocking the app was unknown.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Users were advised to update App Installer and the Microsoft Store app.
* Users were advised to check Windows Defender settings and add exceptions for the application.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with Windows Defender blocking the app was resolved by adding exceptions for the application.
* Further investigation into the cause of Windows Defender blocking the app and the reliability of App Installer is planned.
* Additional information may be added to the Windows documentation and troubleshooting guide. 

**Additional notes:**

* The user reported that manually installing the EXE installer worked for them.
* The user provided screenshots of the error messages and the Windows Defender settings.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** User @ThemePark reported an issue where they are unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop version.

**Key Points:**

* @ThemePark confirmed they have both PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop installed.
* @mack-at-pieces requested the user's Windows version for further troubleshooting.

**Solutions:**

* @pieces-support-bot suggested relevant issues for the user to reference.
* @pieces-support-bot also provided links to helpful resources.
* @mack-at-pieces is investigating the issue and requesting additional information.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is under investigation by @mack-at-pieces.
* No solution has been implemented yet.


**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is ongoing.
* There is no information about the outcome of the investigation.

common_issues.title: Pieces Installation and Launching Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with Pieces installation and launching across Linux and Windows. Problems include Ollama installation failure due to missing dependencies in Linux, Windows installer not working, and non-dismissable overlay messages. Proposed solutions involve fixing dependency issues, investigating installer problems, and improving error handling.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Installation Failure

**Key Points:**

* Ollama installation fails within Pieces due to missing `curl` dependency.
* Pieces-OS is installed as a Snap, which creates a sandboxed environment lacking `curl`.
* User installed Ollama manually, confirming `curl` is available on the system.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation script attempts to use `curl` without checking its availability.
* Snap confinement prevents Pieces from accessing globally installed Ollama.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the Snap definition.
* Patch Pieces to allow using Ollama within a sandboxed environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix is in development and expected to be released in the next week.

**Additional Notes:**

* Issue still present as of 2025-01-23.
* User workaround involves manually installing Ollama and launching it from the terminal.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App on Windows, including a persistent overlay message and processing errors with Copilot. Solutions involve allowing Pieces OS server access, checking for updates, signing in, and ensuring Windows Defender isn't blocking requests. Contact support for persistent issues.

related_issues.title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Pieces Qdrant Server pop up in Pieces OS 8.0.0 Windows
related_issues.text:
ANNOUNCEMENT: Pieces Qdrant Server pop up in Pieces OS 8.0.0 Windows
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

8.0.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Windows users please be aware that with the release of Pieces OS v8.0.0, upon loading the desktop application the first time you may receive the following dialog box:

![image (8)](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/152189388/bd326c95-752d-435f-88d2-9da46d88c46a)

This is a standalone executable that we need to run in order to enable our new long-term memory and other enhancements to the copilot chat experience. This dialog box is expected and in order to receive this new functionality you will need to choose "Allow access." If you deny it, you will likely have a degraded chat experience and it may cause breakages in the app down the line. 

Apologies for the inconvenience; we will work on making this a better user experience going forward.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* The issue is related to including instructions for installing PiecesOS on Windows in the official documentation.

**Problems Identified:**

* The instructions for installing PiecesOS on Windows were not included in the documentation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @jimbobbennett suggests @judson-at-pieces add the instructions to the Windows install docs.
* @judson-at-pieces confirms they will add this issue to their sprint for new PiecesOS documentation and close the issue for now.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed. 
* The instructions for installing PiecesOS on Windows will be included in the new PiecesOS documentation. 
* The timeline for this is not specified.

common_issues.title: Non-Dismissable Overlay Message
common_issues.description: Users are reporting a non-dismissable overlay message appearing in the Pieces Desktop application, often after a background update. This issue prevents interaction with the app, forcing users to restart their system. The issue has been observed on both macOS and Windows platforms. A potential solution involves preventing the overlay from appearing or providing a clear method for dismissal.

related_issues.title: Saved Snippets Welcome Screen
related_issues.text:
Saved Snippets Welcome Screen
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I save a snippet I get a Welcome Message with the first saved snippet every time:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7f8c393f-0097-4f17-997a-75d20c526ce3)

PfD Version: 3.3.3
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Issue reported by @Mack-at-pieces on 2025-01-08 involving a bug in the Desktop App.
* The bug was successfully reproduced by @Mack-at-pieces.
* A fix was implemented and scheduled for the next Desktop App release.
* @Mack-at-pieces confirmed that the issue was patched with Desktop App version 3.3.4.

**Problems Identified:**

* A bug was present in the Desktop App.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patch implemented in Desktop App version 3.3.4.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved and confirmed as fixed in Desktop App version 3.3.4.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue: Copilot Sonnet error response

**Key points raised:**

* User @gittydia reported an error message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong..." when using Pieces Copilot.
* @luigigalli confirmed the issue in macOS with PiecesOS version 11.0.19-staging.

**Problems identified:**

* The error message suggests an issue with processing Copilot requests.
* It's unclear if the problem is specific to the staging build or affects all users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggested waiting for the PiecesOS 11.0.4 release, which was supposed to include a fix.
* He also recommended @luigigalli to switch from the staging build to the production version 11.0.4.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It's unclear if the issue is resolved in PiecesOS 11.0.4.
* Further confirmation from @gittydia and @luigigalli is needed.

**Additional observations:**

* The issue might be related to other reported Copilot problems (linked in the initial comment).
* There are resources available for troubleshooting Pieces issues: existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces Copilot issues:** Focus on addressing connection problems, LLM download failures, and processing errors to improve user experience with this core feature.

**Investigate and resolve Pieces Suite installer and application errors:** Address installer failures, non-dismissable overlay messages, and other reported issues to ensure a smooth onboarding process for new users.
**Improve error handling and messaging:** Provide clearer error messages to users, explaining the cause of the issue and potential solutions. This will reduce user frustration and support requests.
**Enhance communication around updates:** Clearly communicate the purpose and impact of background updates to users, and provide a way to dismiss or interact with overlay messages related to updates.
**Review and update installation documentation:** Ensure that installation instructions for all platforms, including Linux and Windows, are up-to-date and address common issues encountered by users.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces Copilot:** Given the frequency of issues related to this feature, a dedicated support channel could help streamline issue resolution and information sharing.
**Gather more data on the non-dismissable overlay message:** Identify the specific conditions that trigger this error message to help pinpoint the root cause and develop a fix.
**Proactively monitor and address issues with new releases:** Implement a system for monitoring user feedback and identifying potential issues early on after a new release to minimize user impact.

**Improve communication and transparency:** Keep users informed about the status of known issues and the progress being made towards resolving them. This can help manage expectations and reduce support requests.
